{{Infobox musical artist | name = Larry McCray | image = LarryMcCrayMonterey2011.jpg | caption = Larry McCray performing at the 2011 Monterey Blues Festival.
Photo by Mike Shea/Tritone Photography | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Larry McCray | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1960|4|5|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Magnolia, Arkansas|Magnolia]], [[Arkansas]], United States | death_date = | death_place = | instrument = [[Guitar]], [[Human voice|vocals]] | genre = [[Blues]], [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] | occupation = [[Guitarist]], [[singing|singer]], [[songwriter]] | years_active = 1980s-present | label = [[Point Blank Records|Point Blank]], Atomic Theory, House of Blues, Magnolia, Dixiefrog | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|http://www.larrymccrayband.com/}} }} '''Larry McCray''' (born April 5, 1960, [[Magnolia, Arkansas|Magnolia]], [[Arkansas]], United States) is an [[United States|American]] [[blues]] [[guitarist]] and [[singing|singer]]. ==Biography== McCray, the second youngest of nine siblings, grew up living on a farm.[http://www.allaboutjazz.com/php/musician.php?id=9242 ]{{dead link|date=January 2014}} McCray learned [[guitar]] from his sister, Clara.{{cite web|author=Bill Dahl |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/larry-mccray-mn0000131711/biography |title=Larry McCray | Biography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1960-04-05 |accessdate=2014-01-26}} "She used to play real low-down and dirty", McCray recalled years later.{{cite book | first= Tony | last= Russell | year= 1997 | title= The Blues: From Robert Johnson to Robert Cray | edition= | publisher= Carlton Books Limited | location= Dubai | pages= 141–142 | isbn= 1-85868-255-X}} His family moved to [[Saginaw, Michigan|Saginaw]], [[Michigan]] in 1972, and McCray took the influence of his sibling, and such as the three Kings ([[B.B. King|B.B.]], [[Freddie King|Freddie]] and [[Albert King|Albert]]) to playing the local club circuit, with his brothers Carl on [[bass guitar]] and Steve on [[drum]]s. After [[high school]], McCray worked on [[General Motors]]' assembly line, before [[sound recording and reproduction|recording]] ''Ambition'', his 1991 debut [[album]] for [[Point Blank Records]], in a [[Detroit]] friend's basement [[recording studio]]. He was soon [[concert tour|touring]] with his [[record label|label]]-mate, [[Albert Collins]]. His 1993 follow-up, ''Delta Hurricane'', was [[record producer|produced]] by the veteran [[United Kingdom|British]] blues devotee, [[Mike Vernon (producer)|Mike Vernon]]. In 1999, McCray recorded a [[cover version]] of [[Bob Dylan]]'s "[[All Along the Watchtower]]" for the [[tribute album]], ''[[Tangled Up in Blues]].'' In 2000, McCray founded his own independent record label, Magnolia Records, and ''Believe It'' was its first release that same year. Magnolia released McCray's first [[live album]], ''Live on Interstate 75,'' in mid-2006, and this was followed in 2007 with ''Larry McCray.'' His most recent tour commenced in [[Chicago]] on December 11, 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.larrymccrayband.com/ |title=The Official Website for Larry McCray |publisher=larrymccrayband.com |date= |accessdate=2014-01-26}} McCray has one son, Bleau McCray-Morel with Kelly Morel. ==Discography== *''Ambition'' (1990) *''Delta Hurricane'' (1993) *''Meet Me at The Lake'' (1996) with The Bluegills *''Born to Play the Blues'' (1998) *''Believe It'' (2000) *''Blues is my Business'' (2001) *''Live on Interstate 75'' (2006) *''Larry McCray'' (2007){{cite web|author= |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/larry-mccray-mn0000131711/discography |title=Larry McCray | Discography |publisher=AllMusic |date=1960-04-05 |accessdate=2014-01-26}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.larrymccrayband.com/ Official website] *[{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p451/biography|pure_url=yes}} Biography] at [[Allmusic]] {{Authority control|VIAF=55864366}} {{Persondata | NAME =McCray, Larry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =[[United States|American]] [[blues]] guitarist and singer] | DATE OF BIRTH =April 5, 1960 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Magnolia, Arkansas]], [[United States]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:McCray, Larry}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American blues guitarists]] [[Category:American blues singers]] [[Category:American male singers]] [[Category:American blues musicians]] [[Category:Musicians from Arkansas]] [[Category:Songwriters from Arkansas]]
